q: Obedience and respect for authority are the most important virtues children should learn.
It is to be expected to see hierarchy remain, as anyone can be better or worse than others.
Workers in the most essential parts of the economy should not be allowed to strike.
There should be no managers with authority over workers.
Prisoners should be forced to work to repay their debt to society.
Neither police nor private security firms.
At some point, the state will no longer be necessary.
Caste system is not bad.
All unions and other labor organizations not affiliated with the state or government should be banned.
Monarchy is best form of governance, especially abaolute one.
Ideally, politicians would not exist.
The hiring and firing of workers should not be down to the whims of bosses.
Natural resources belong to whoever found them first and did the required prospecting.
Ideal system would allow individuals to voluntarily enter into slave contracts.
World would be much better place without private productive property.
Private investors and speculators are needed in the modern economy.
Landlords are unnecessary to society.
Theft can never be justified.
Inheritance is not a legitimate form of wealth.
Copyrights and patents are worthless, as intellectual property belongs to everyone.
Victimless crimes should not be considered crimes at all.
I believe in spontaneous order.
No individual should ever be required to serve any collective expectation.
An individual should be allowed to do whatever they want with their own body.
Trade between two consenting individuals should never be obstructed.
People are dumb and limits should be put on dangerous actions to protect them.
Nobody should be restricted from using abandoned property.
Monopolies, state or otherwise, should never be allowed to exist.
Hierarchy is always coercive and thus cannot ever be justified.
Corporations and the state are evils which perpetuate one another.
Worker cooperatives are not any better than traditional firms.
I emphasize the absolute priority of self-interest.
A classless society is a desirable end goal.
More laws should be determined by referendums.
Tyranny of the majority is a legitimate concern.
The most important parts of the economy should be nationalised.
The economy needs regulating by the government in order to function correctly.
Income tax is a necessary evil, if an evil at all.
Sometimes state needs to intervene for greater good.
Education should be state-run and mandatory to ensure quality education for all children.
Workers should negotiate for wages independently not collectively.
All workplaces should be unionized.
Slave labor is justified if its productive enough.
State welfare programs should be replaced by charity or mutual aid.
Large scale organisations can increase efficiency.
The economy should be organized by profession groups performing their function.
Prisons are oppressive and antiquated institutions that need to be abolished.
”From each according to his ability, to each according to his needs“ is a good principle.
Foreign investments are to be welcomed.
The government should be capable of assigning individuals to workplaces.
Authorities should not be questionned as long as they provide stability.
Workers should fight in class struggle.
Workers deserve a greater part of what they create.
Collective agriculture is much better than private or individual one.
It's wasteful to have so many different brands of the same good.
We should reduce bureaucracy a lot.
We must make sure everyone has enough to live, even if that negatively affects the economy.
The state should control all aspects of the economy.
The freer the market, the freer the people.
More people should aim to be self employed.
Workers should seize the means of production.
Wealth accumulation leads to the creation of an oppressive class system.
Firearms should be available to the general public.
There is nothing unethical in wage labour.
People should be allowed to do whatever they want in their own yard.
Just because something is consensual doesn't mean it is right.
A nonmonetary economy is something we should strive for.
Usuries and other forms of private loans are nothing good.
The hiring and firing of workers should not be down to the whims of bosses.
Employees should have more say in the workplace.
Sometimes you have to sacrifice the good of an individual for the good of collective.
People should be economically deterred from spending their money on useless products, by banning them.
The economy should be organised on the local level.
The right to start a business is fundamental to any thriving economy.
Employment should be guaranteed.
In times of crisis, safety takes precedence over liberty.
The “Right to Travel” does not exist
Certain services like roads and public transportation should be run by the state.
Unitary government is better than federal one.
There should be no central bank.
There should be no fiat currency.
